intro: Pleroma australe, commonly known as the Australian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Pleroma australe is often found in heathlands and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
